metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11059 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
Das U-Boot 2016.11-rc1 through 2019.04 mishandles the ext4 64-bit extension, resulting in a buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11059` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

u-boot - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-amlogic - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-exynos - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-imx - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-mvebu - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-omap - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-qcom - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-rockchip - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-rpi - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-sunxi - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-tegra - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-tools - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: u-boot package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6').
